title: Strategic Human Resource Management (HRM)-Based Employee Training Effectiveness Design (Case Study in Math Education)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Human Resource Management (HRM) Concepts and Mathematics Instruction Experience
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen learner-specific customized instructional design capabilities, using TWOS analysis (assessment of strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats) to diagnose educational effectiveness and derive improvement strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically model and explain the core principles of SHRM and employee training effectiveness.
Learners can quantify strategic improvements for educational programs by applying TWOS analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats).
Learners can design technical infrastructure requirements and communication channels for e-learning systems using mathematical optimization techniques.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
